reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is conveniently about 300 meters from the Rialto stop and down a side alley. You have to pay attention to the street numbers to find the place. We only saw Andrea, the owner, once -- at breakfast, the day after we checked in. His wife arranged to be present when we arrived and checked us in. Other than that, and early mornings when Helena is cleaning, the B&B is deserted. They make it very clear that they are accessible by cell phone and that you can call a sister hotel through the phone in your room if you need assistance.
reviews.title: Convenient!

reviews.text: The B&B accepts credit cards - unlike what the previous reviewer stated. We made our reservations through venere.com.
reviews.title: Great choice for Venice

reviews.text: The B&B is on the fourth floor - they call it 3rd floor in Italy.
reviews.title: A great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are very firm - we had a king sized - which was really two twins pushed together. The room was quite large and the bathroom was large too. Our room was green. I don't know if that's what it was called. It overlooked a canal (not the grand canal) that had tons of gondolas and singing gondoliers going by all day, especially in the evening.
reviews.title: Location, location!
